question.content: Zakir Hussain, Ustad Allah Rakha, Pandit Shankar Ghosh, Pandit Udhai Mazumdar, Pandit Vijay Ghate.
Asad Ali Khan was known for playing which of the following Indian instruments?
Hari Prasad Chaurasia is a notable exponent of which musical instrument?

solution.content: Flute. Hariprasad Chaurasia awards: Padma Bhushan (1992), Padma Vibhushan (2000), Gan Samradni Lata mangeshkar Award (2021-22), Sangeet Natak Academy Award (1983). Some other flute players: Ronu Majumdar, Rakesh Chaurasia, Pannalal Ghosh, Nityanand Haldipur, Vivek Sonar.

question.content: Prabhat Sarma, a recipient of Sangeet Natak Akademi Award, was a _ player from Assam.

solution.content: Flute. Prabhat Sarma's awards:- Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2003), Asom Shilpi Diwas Award by the Assam government (2001). Flute is the part of the woodwind family group.

question.content: Famous musician Talvin Singh is associated with playing the_

solution.content: Tabla. Other tabla players: Sol.470.(b) Rudra Veena. It is a stringed instrument, which is made of teak wood, metal, pumpkin, and Bamboo. He received Padma Bhushan (2008) and Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1977). Rudra Veena exponents: Madhuvanti Pal, Bahauddin Dagar, Zia Mohiuddin Dagar.

question.content: Pandit Ram Narayan, a famous instrumentalist, is known for playing which of the following instruments?

solution.content: Sarangi. A sarangi is a bowed stringed instrument with a skin-covered resonator. Pandit Ram Narayan awards Padma Shri (1976), Padma Bhushan (1991) and Padma Vibhushan (2005). Other sarangi players- Ustad Sultan Khan, Ustad Binda Khan, Suhali Yusuf Khan.

question.content: Hara Shankar Bhattacharya is a maestro of

solution.content: Sitar: It is a stringed instrument of the lute family. Its other Artists Pandit Ravi Shankar, Nikhil Banerjee, Vilayat Khan.

question.content: Neeruswamy Pillai and Rajaratanam Pillai are exponents of which musical instrument?

solution.content: Nadaswaram. It is a double reed wind instrument from South India. Other Exponents - Sheik Chinna Moulana, Karukurichi Arunachalam, Thiruvizha Jayashankar, and Namagiripettai Krishnan. Mridangam- Ramnad Raghavan, TK Murthy, Dandamudi Ram Mohan Rao, T Gopalakrishnan. Mandolin - Uppalapu Srinivas, Kishore Desai.

question.content: Pandit Bhajan Sopori, who died in the year 2022, was a famous player of which musical instruments?

solution.content: Santoor (String Instrument). Bhajan Sopori (Saint of the Santoor and the King of Strings) belonged to the Sufiana Gharana of Indian classical music. Awards : Padma Shri (2004), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1993). Santoor players: Pandit Shivkumar Sharma, Abhay Sopori, Tarun Bhattacharya.

question.content: T.N. Rajaratnam Pillai is a player of which of the following musical instruments?

solution.content: Nadaswaram. It is a double reed wind instrument from South India similar to Shehnai of North India. Other Players of Nadaswaram: Sheikh Chinna Maulana, Sheikh Mahaboob Subhani and Namagiripettai Krishnan.

question.content: Who among the following Indian musicians is the inventor of Mohan Veena?

solution.content: Pandit Vishwa Mohan Bhatt. Awards - Grammy Award (1994) for Best Global Music Album (A Meeting by the River), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1998), Padma Shri (2002), Padma Bhushan (2017). Other Mohan veena players- Harry Manx, Matt Malley. Totaram Sharma (pakhawaj player). Brij Bhushan Kabra (guitar player). Sandeep Das (tabla player).

question.content: Which musical instrument does N Rajam play?

solution.content: Violin. Other players: Violin - Ragini Shankar, Kala Ramnath, Balabhaskar. Sitar Ustad Shahid Parvez Khan. Santoor Pandit Shivkumar Sharma, Satish Vyas. Guitar Baiju Dharmajan, Susmit Sen, Amyt Datta.

question.content: Ustad Akbar Ali Khan is remembered for his contribution to which of the following musical instruments?

solution.content: Sarod. Akbar Ali Khan (Maihar gharana). Awards- Padmа Bhushan (1967), Padma Vibhushan (1989). Famous Players (Sarod): Amjad Ali Khan, Buddhadev Das Gupta, Tejendra Majumdar, Allauddin Khan.

question.content: RK Bijapure played which of the following musical instruments?

solution.content: Harmonium. R K Bijapure (1985- "Karnataka Kala Tilak" by Sangeet Nritya Academy). Harmonium Purushottam Walawalkar, Appa Jalgaonkar. Ravanahatha Dinesh Subasinghe.

question.content: Arvind Parikh is associated with which of the following musical instruments?

solution.content: Sitar. Arvind Parikh: Awards - Padma Bhushan (2018), Sangeet Natak Akademi (2003). Sitar - Pt Ravi Shankar, Budhaditya Mukherjee.

question.content: The name of Ustad Vilayat Khan is associated with which of the following Indian musical instruments?

solution.content: Sitar.

question.content: Which musical instrument Dr AР J Abdul Kalam, former President of India, used to play?

solution.content: Veena (Stringed instrument). APJ Abdul Kalam: He served as the 11th president of India and known as the Missile Man of India. Exponents of Veena Rajhesh Vaidhya, Jayanthi Kumaresh, Veena E. Gayathri, Emani Sankara Sastry. is

question.content: Ramnad V Raghavan associated with which of the following musical instruments?

solution.content: Mridangam. Famous Mridangam Players: A.V. Anand, Muthiah Bhagavatar, Guruvayur Dorai, Palghat Mani lyer Karaikudi Mani, T. K. Murthy.

question.content: Totaram Sharma is associated with which of the following instruments?

solution.content: Pakhawaj is a barrel-shaped, two-headed drum, originating from the Indian subcontinent. Totaram Sharma received Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2011). Famous Pakhawaj Players: Pandit Purushottam Das, Mohan Shyam Sharma, Bhavani Shankar, Pandit Prem Vallabh.

question.content: The musician Sivamani is associated with which musical instrument?

solution.content: Drums. Awards Kalaimamani (2009), Padma Shri (2019).

question.content: Who among the following is associated with the musical instrument Surbahar?

solution.content: Annapurna Devi. Awarded Padma Bhushan in 1977. Other Surbahar musicians Kushal Das, Imrat Khan, Mushtaq Ali Khan, Hiren Roy, Irshad Khan.

question.content: Select the correct sequence of the musical instruments according to the given sequence of their associated personalities: Ustad Allah Rakha, Totaram Sharma, TH Vinayakam.

solution.content: Tabla, Pakhawaj, Ghatam. Tabla is the most famous percussion instrument of North India. Pakhawaj is an ancient drum, it is the preferred percussion instrument of the ancient singing style called Dhrupad. A Ghatam is a large, narrow-mouthed earthenware pot used as a percussion instrument.

question.content: Tansen, who was included in the Navaratnas of Akbar, was an expert in playing which of the following musical instruments?

solution.content: Rabab (String instrument). Tansen (Ramtanu Pandey) - A Hindustani classical musician also Known as Sangeeth Samrat or Mian (Learned One). Tansen Samaroh is celebrated every year in the month of December in Gwalior district.

question.content: The famous musician, Faiyaz Khan is associated with which musical instrument?

solution.content: Tabla (Membranophone percussion instrument). The Maharaja of Mysore awarded him the title "Aftab e- Mausiqi" (the Sun of Music) in 1908.

question.content: Select the Indian musician who is associated with percussion instruments (played by striking).

solution.content: Pandit Ayodhya Prasad. Percussion Instruments:- Ghatam TH Vinayakram, EM Subramaniam, Mridangam- Dakshinamurthy Pillai, Rajna Swaminathan. String Instruments :- Guitar - Braj Bhushan Kabra.

question.content: Which of the following instruments is performed by Nandini and Ragini Shankar?

solution.content: Violin. Other Exponents- Jyotsna Srikanth, Abhijith P.S. Nair, L. Subramaniam, K. Vaidyanathan, Nagai R Muralidharan, Mohanan Chandrasekaran. Veena - Muthuswami Dikshitar, Veenai Dhanammal, Doraiswamy lyengar, Emani Sankara Sastry, S Balachander. Mridangam Tanjore Ramdasa Rao, Palghat Ramchandra lyer, Ramnad V Raghavan, Karaikudi R Mani, Guruvayur Dorai.

question.content: Which of the following music instruments are solid instruments?

solution.content: Ghana Vadya. Solid instruments are usually played with a striker or hammer. These instruments are not capable of producing definite pitches that are required for creating a melody. That is why their use is limited in classical music. Tata Vadya These are Stringed instruments. Avanaddha Vadya These are percussion instruments. Sushira Vadya- These are wind instruments. The Shehnai is a popular wind instrument in India.

question.content: The shehnai is a reed instrument with how many holes along the tubes?

solution.content: Seven. Shehnai - It is a reed instrument in which there are seven holes along the tube which are used for playing the melody by opening and closing them with the fingers. It is known as Mangal Vadya. It is considered to have come to India from West Asia. In the early fifties of this century, Ustad Bismillah Khan is credited for popularising this instrument. Pt. Anant Lal and Pt. Daya Shankar is also a noted Shehnai player.

question.content: What is Tat Vadya?

solution.content: Stringed instruments. Tata Vadya - Sound produced by vibration of a string or chord. Example - Veena, Sitar, Sarangi etc. The Percussion Instruments Congo, Bongo, Djembe, Darbukas, Hand Drums and Tongue Drums. Idiophones or Ghana Vadya are solid instruments that do not need any further tuning. Examples Piccolo, Manjira, Jaltarang, Jhanj and Chimta. Wind instruments - woodwinds, such as the flute, clarinet, oboe, and bassoon, also include brass instruments like horn and trumpet.

question.content: Flute instruments come under which type of instrument category?

solution.content: Sushira Vadya (Wind instrument). Example Flute, Shehnai, Nadaswaram. Ghana Vadya - Considered to be the world's first instrument. It does not require tuning. Example - Manjira, Khartal, Chimta, Ghatam, Jaltarang etc. Avanaddha Vadya - Sound produced by striking on animal skin. Example - Tabla, Mridangam, Dhol, Damru etc.

question.content: Bickram Ghosh, a recipient of Global Indian Music Award, is a music composer and an Indian classical _ player.

solution.content: Tabla. On 1 October 2012, Ghosh won the 2012 Global Indian Music Academy (GIMA) Awards in the Best Pop/Rock Single category for his composition, Vande Mataram.

question.content: Padma Vibhushan awardee Umayalpuram K. Sivaraman is a_ player.

solution.content: Mridangam. Umayalpuram K. Shivaraman is the Mridangam Player. More Awards he got are Sangeetha Kalasikhamani from The Indian Fine Arts Society in 1984, Kalaimamani (Tamil Nadu,1977), Sangeetha Kalanidhi from Madras Music Academy in 2001, Padma Vibhushan from Government of India in 2010.

question.content: Rajeev Taranath, a disciple of Ali Akbar Khan, isa player.

solution.content: Sarod. He is conferred with many awards such as the Padma Shri (2019), Sangeet Vidhwan Award (2018), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1999-2000), Sangeet Nritya Akademi Award (1993), Karnataka Rajya Prashasti (1996).

question.content: Pandit Ananda Gopal Bandopadhyay was a player of the Banaras gharana.

solution.content: Tabla. In 1965, he won the first prize in The All India Radio music competition, and was awarded the President's Gold Medal. In 2012, he was awarded the Sangeet Ratna Award by the Salt Lake Music Association.

question.content: Padma Bhushan awardee Ustad Sabri Khan was a player.

solution.content: Sarangi. Ustad Sabri Khan was awarded Shobhna Kala Sangam Award (1985), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1986), Padma Shri (1992), Ustad Chand Khan Award (2002), Sangeet Bhushan Award (2002), Padma Bhushan (2006), etc.

question.content: Who among the following is India's only publicly well-known woman shehnai player?

solution.content: Bageshwari Qamar. Gauhar Jaan was an Indian singer (thumri, Dadra, kajri, and Tarana) and dancer from Kolkata. Binodini Dasi was an Indian Bengali actress and thespian. Rasoolan Hussain was a leading Indian Hindustani classical music vocalist, belonging to the Benaras Gharana.

question.content: Padma Bhushan awardee Pandit Nikhil Jyoti Ghosh was a player.

solution.content: Tabla. Pandit Nikhil Jyoti Ghosh was an Indian musician known for his proficiency on the percussion instrument tabla. He was awarded the Padma Bhushan (1990) and the Ustad Hafiz Ali Khan Award (1995).

question.content: Who among the following is an outstanding player to have mastered the surbahar instrument?

solution.content: Ustad Imrat Khan. He was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1988), and the Padma Shri award (2017).

question.content: Padma Bhushan awardee Vikku Vinayakaram is a player.

solution.content: Ghatam. Vikku Vinayakram (percussionist) plays Ghatam, and Morsing (instrument mainly used in Rajasthan). Other Ghatam players include Umayalpuram, K. Narayanaswamy, Tripunithura N. Radhakrishnan, Giridhar Udupa, Trichy Sankaran, etc.

question.content: Lalgudi Gopala lyer Jayaraman used to play which of the following instruments?

solution.content: Violin. Lalgudi Gopala lyer Jayaraman was an Indian Carnatic violinist, vocalist and composer. He was awarded the Padma Shri (1972), Padma Bhushan (2001) and National Film Award (Best Music Direction; Sringaram; 2006).

question.content: Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri is associated with instrument.

solution.content: Tabla. Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri: Awards Sangeet Natak Academy Award (1996), Padma Shri (2019).

question.content: Which of the following pairs is INCORRECT?

solution.content: Kumar Gandharva was a Hindustani classical singer well known for his unique vocal style and his refusal to be bound by the tradition of any gharana.

question.content: A Ghatam is a

options.text: large, narrow-mouthed earthenware pot used as a percussion instrument
small handheld drum that resembles a tambourine
wind instrument made of wood and metal
percussion instrument made of leather and jackwood.

answer: large, narrow-mouthed earthenware pot used as a percussion instrument

solution.content: A Ghatam is a large, narrow-mouthed earthenware pot used as a percussion instrument. Examples of Percussion instruments- Piano, Timpani, Xylophone, Cymbals, Triangle, Drums, Tambourine, Maracas.

question.content: Which of the following musical instruments did Dwaram Venkataswamy Naidu play? (b) Mandolin

solution.content: Violin. Awards and Honours:- Padma Shri (1957), Sangeeta Kalanidhi (1941), Kalaprapoorna (1950), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1953), Raja Lakshmi Award (1992).

question.content: Which of the following is not a percussion instrument?

options.text: sarod bass drum, tambourine, maracas, gongs, chimes, celesta, and piano. Sarod, stringed musical instrument of the lute family.

question.content: Which of the following musical instruments is also known as a 'Mangal Vadya'?

solution.content: Shehnai. Ustad Bismillah Khan is a famous Shehnai Player. Shehnai is a wind instrument made of wood and metal.

question.content: A distinct 'Dhrupad style' is associated with the gharana.

solution.content: Bishnupur. Tansen was a famous Dhrupad instrument player. It is the oldest known style of major vocal styles associated with Hindustani classical music, Haveli Sangeet of Pushtimarg Sampraday and also related to the South Indian Carnatic tradition.

question.content: Which of the following instruments is normally played in a vertical position and with an arched bow?

solution.content: Sarangi. The Sarangi is a fretless, bowed string instrument used in Hindustani classical music and folk traditions of north India.

question.content: 'Ponu Yoksi', a sword like instrument used during ceremonial dances performed by the priests, belongs to:

solution.content: Arunachal Pradesh. Some popular instruments (Arunachal Pradesh) include drums, cymbals, Ujuk Tapu, Ame Bali, Emul, Pui, Kiring, Guga etc.

question.content: The Kamaicha is a bowed flute played by the Manganiars of:

solution.content: Sarod. The percussion family of musical instruments consists of membranophones and idiophones. Examples- Ghatam, Tabla, Mridangam, timpani, xylophone, cymbals, snare drum, Sol.515.(a) West Rajasthan. It is a stringed instrument made of steel, parchment, gut, metal, shisham, and horsehair.

question.content: 'Chinkara' is a Carnatic classical music known as Bobbili Veena/Saraswathi Veena? musical instrument popular in the state of

solution.content: Stringed. It is made of parchment, wood and steel. This instrument is used by the 'Pradhan community of Madhya Pradesh and the 'Meo' community of Rajasthan.

question.content: The traditional binding instrument called "Pena" is related to which of the following state?

solution.content: Manipur. Pena is also known as Tingtelia is a mono string instrument falling in the lute category, similar to some of the traditional Indian stringed musical instruments such as Ravanahatha, Ubo or the Kenda, found in various parts of the country.

question.content: The musical instrument 'Kartal' from the state of Rajasthan comes under the category of

solution.content: Idiophone is a percussion instrument. It is classified as an idiophone because the entire instrument vibrates to produce a sound on its own.

question.content: The_ is a single string musical instrument made using bamboo and a gourd, mostly used by traditional folk singers in Maharashtra.

solution.content: Ektara is a drone flute consisting of a gourd resonator covered with skin, through which a bamboo neck is inserted. Ektara means "one string".

question.content: 'Khuang' is a traditional musical instrument of which state?

solution.content: Mizoram. It is made up of a hollow tree, wrapped on both sides with animal skin.

question.content: The wood of which of the following trees is used to make the large plucked string instrument used in

solution.content: Jackfruit wood. Bobbili Veena is carved from a single piece of jackfruit wood.
